sections.title: Description
sections.raw_content: Dir.Exists returns true if a directory by the name of directoryPathName exists. It will return false if directoryPathName is a file.
sections.mdown_content: **Dir.Exists **returns **true** if a directory by the name of *directoryPathName* exists. It will return **false** if *directoryPathName* is a file.

sections.title: Details
sections.raw_content: If the Dir.Exists returns false, you can examine Error.Last or Error.LastMsg for more information (i.e. whether the path failed or the directory was simply not found).
sections.mdown_content: If the **Dir.Exists** returns **false**, you can examine **Error.Last** or **Error.LastMsg** for more information (i.e. whether the path failed or the directory was simply not found).

sections.title: Example
code:
if Dir.Exists ("d:/usr/west") then
            put "Directory exists"
        else
            put "Directory does not exists: ", Error.LastMsg
        end if
Status  
 Exported qualified.
This means that you can only call the function by calling Dir.Exists, not by calling Exists.
